title: Concerns over misleading post on sexual wellbeing clinic
byline: Serious concerns have been raised following the circulation of a post claiming the launch of an “LGBTQIA+ Sexual Wellbeing Clinic” at the National Hospital in Kandy.

title: Police call for applications to fill 25 medical vacancies
byline: The Sri Lanka Police has called for applications from qualified medical professionals in both the public and private sectors to fill 25 vacancies in the Police Medical Service Division.

title: MP Archchuna granted bail
byline: MP Ramanathan Archchuna, who was arrested by Fort Police this morning (29), has been granted bail by the Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: Ramanathan Archchuna arrested
byline: MP Ramanathan Archchuna was arrested by Fort Police this morning (29) when he arrived at the station to give a statement.

title: President to meet Japanese Prime Minister today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, on an official visit to Japan at the invitation of the Japanese government, is scheduled to meet Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba today (29) at the Prime Minister’s Office in Tokyo.

title: China’s ex-agriculture minister sentenced to death with reprieve for huge bribes
byline: China’s state-run media report that a court in the country has sentenced a former agriculture and rural affairs minister to death with a two-year reprieve for receiving massive bribes.

title: UPDATE: Mawanella earth mound collapse; Three bodies found
byline: The bodies of three workers have been recovered after a mound of earth collapsed at a construction site in Manikkawa, Mawanella, police said.

title: Suspect arrested in Kottawa with live ammunition and heroin
byline: A 24-year-old person from Angulana, Moratuwa, was arrested in the Kottawa area by the Police Special Task Force with 458 live rounds of ammunition and a T-56 cartridge, police said.

title: System needed to monitor money collection in schools, Bribery Commission DG
byline: A system should be developed to investigate the collection of money from students in schools through development societies or other channels, and to implement existing circulars and related activities in a systematic manner, Director General of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) Ranga Dissanayake said.

title: Workers trapped as earth collapses at construction site
byline: A mound of earth collapsed on a group of workers building a wall in the Manikkawa area of Mawanella.

title: Gammanpila files complaint over ruling MPs’ use of salaries for party funds
byline: Pivithuru Hela Urumaya leader Udaya Gammanpila filed a complaint with the Bribery Commission today alleging that government MPs are diverting their monthly salaries to party funds for political activities.

title: Measures afoot to fast-track drug purchases
byline: A special procurement system is to be introduced to fast-track the purchasing of drugs in Sri Lanka, Deputy Minister of Health Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni said.

title: Harthal planned in Mannar today against wind power project: Archchuna
byline: A harthal is set to be launched today in Mannar in protest against the government’s decision to continue with the Mannar wind power project, Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna said. He urged public participation in the protest.

title: Winners India refuse Asia Cup trophy from ACC chief
byline: India beat Pakistan to defend their Asia Cup title but refused to accept the trophy from Pakistan’s interior minister Mohsin Naqvi in a bizarre end to a politically-charged tournament on Sunday.

title: Cough, fever, body ache: H3N2 flu cases spike in India
byline: Delhi and its neighbouring cities are witnessing a rise in H3N2 cases — an Influenza A subtype virus — over the past few months, with doctors cautioning that symptoms this time are more intense than in previous years.

title: Wasim Thajudeen’s death: Family urges fresh probe
byline: The family of the late Sri Lanka rugby player Wasim Thajudeen has urged the Anura Kumara Dissanayake-led government to reopen investigations into his death, claiming that justice has been denied for over 13 years.

title: Govt. consults AG over Singapore company’s refusal to pay X-Press Pearl compensation
byline: In the wake of the Singapore shipping company refusing to pay the Supreme Court-ordered compensation of US $ 1 billion over the X-Press Pearl disaster, the government has consulted the Attorney General on the next step to be taken, a Minister said yesterday.

title: SL taps Google to offer free AI research tools to students
byline: Sri Lankan students will soon get free access to Google’s Gemini Advanced research tools and other digital resources, the Ministry of Digital Economy said today.

title: Underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka has been prevented from revealing bribe seeking cops - his father says
byline: Nelson Mervin Wickramaratne, the father of Nadun Chinthaka, commonly known as Harak Kata claims that his son suspects that he is being unjustly held in detention under PTA to prevent him from revealing details of senior police officers and politicians who had sought bribes.

title: Politics and taxes have kept some exhibitors out of book fair: MP
byline: Some exhibitors who have participated in the Colombo International Book Fair previously have kept away from the exhibition this year due to political interference, Opposition MP Amila Prasad Siriwardana alleged yesterday.

title: Police, Customs and Revenue Depts. top corruption lists
byline: In a candid and data-driven address, the head of Sri Lanka’s anti-corruption watchdog has revealed that the public institutions are perceived as the most corrupt by citizens, while simultaneously identifying a separate list of state bodies whose corrupt activities inflict the most severe damage on the national economy.

title: Man shocks mourners by showing up to his own funeral alive
byline: An Argentinian man showed up to his own funeral, leaving mourners bewildered as to whose body they were burying.

title: Sri Lanka’s investment climate constrained-U.S. report says
byline: Despite the government’s rhetoric, the country’s investment climate remains constrained, and investors report that doing business remains difficult, frequently citing concerns about project reversals, regulatory shifts, slow decision-making, and inadequate support for established businesses, according to the U.S. Department of State.

title: Four killed in shooting and arson attack at Mormon church in Michigan
byline: At least four people have been killed and eight others injured after a gunman drove a vehicle into a Michigan church, opened fire and set the building ablaze, police say.

title: Stop promoting LGBTQ tourism: Cardinal
byline: Criticising the government’s move to allow the promotion of LGBTQ tourism in Sri Lanka, Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith said such a move would destroy the country’s culture.

title: Police on high alert over dirty cops leaking information to underworld
byline: Sri Lanka Police are on the lookout for rogue officers suspected of leaking sensitive information to underworld figures, following shocking revelations that notorious criminal Kehelbaddara Padme was reportedly tipped off about a secret overseas mission to arrest him.

title: CB to tighten oversight on crypto service providers amid money laundering concerns
byline: In a move to crack down on potential money laundering, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka announced it will soon mandate that all cryptocurrency (crypto) and virtual asset service providers register with the government to continue their operations.

title: Public sector wages now ‘fair’, no longer an excuse for corruption, says Anti-Graft Chief
byline: The long-held excuse that low public sector salaries contribute to a culture of corruption is no longer valid, according to the head of Sri Lanka’s anti-corruption commission.

title: India beat Pakistan by five wickets to clinch ninth Asia Cup title
byline: Tilak Varma hit an unbeaten 69 as India defeated Pakistan by five wickets for a record-extending ninth Asia Cup title with no handshakes between the sides again on Sunday.

title: Sri Lankan tea factory sets global record
byline: Elevating the global profile of Ceylon Tea, New Vithanakande Ceylon Black Tea (FFExSp) has entered the Guinness World Records as the most expensive tea ever sold.

title: Minister blasts doctors fueling false medicine crisis
byline: Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has accused certain politically active doctors of receiving funds from pharmaceutical companies and fabricating news stories to disrupt the country’s medicine supply.

title: CID seeks court approval to access phones of Backhoe Saman’s wife
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today informed Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama that it sought permission to obtain a statement regarding the mobile phones in the possession of Shadhika Lakshani, the wife of ’Backhoe Saman’, who is currently in remand custody under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: President meets Japanese Finance, Defence Ministers
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is on an official visit to Japan at the invitation of the Japanese government, held bilateral discussions with Japanese Minister of Finance Kato Katsunobu and Japanese Defence Minister D.M. Nakatani.

title: Mephedrone detected in Sri Lanka for first time
byline: Sri Lanka has detected the highly dangerous synthetic stimulant drug ‘Mephedrone’ for the first time and a foreigner has been arrested.

title: Mannar protest sends powerful message to government: Namal
byline: The collective voice of the people of Mannar, strongly opposing the controversial wind turbine and sand mining projects, sends a powerful message to the government, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa said.

title: Japan–Sri Lanka to further deepen cooperation in security, economy, investment
byline: Recalling the long-standing friendly relations between Japan and Sri Lanka, Japan and Sri Lanka reaffirmed their intention to further deepen and expand cooperation, including inter alia in the areas of security, economy, investment, and development cooperation, under the framework of the deepened and expanded Comprehensive Partnership established between the two countries.

title: BASL defends legality of lawyers’ car passes
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL), in a letter to the Inspector General of Police (IGP), has clarified matters relating to lawyers’ car passes, which recently came under public discussion.

title: Vijay’s Chennai residence receives bomb threat, day after stampede at TVK’s Karur rally kills 41
byline: The Chennai police received a call regarding the bomb threat at Vijay’s Neelankarai home on Sunday.

title: Medical student killed in Kadugannawa road accident
byline: A 24-year-old medical student was killed in a road accident at Urapola junction in Kadugannawa, Police said.

title: Concerns over misleading LGBTQ clinic post
byline: Serious concerns have been raised following the circulation of a post claiming the launch of an “LGBTQIA+ Sexual Wellbeing Clinic” at the National Hospital in Kandy.

title: Minister says Sri Lankan tea wins Nobel Prize
byline: In a bizarre statement, Industries Minister Sunil Handunnetti said yesterday that Sri Lanka had ‘won the Nobel Prize for tea’ after entering the Guinness World Records for producing the world’s most expensive tea.

title: 12 garment factory workers injured in bus accident
byline: At least 12 passengers were injuried when a private bus belonging to a garment factory met with an accident on the Randenigala road, police said.

title: Trump considering supplying Ukraine with long-range missiles, Vance says
byline: The US is considering a request by Ukraine for long-range Tomahawk missiles, US Vice-President JD Vance has said.

title: CSE opens week higher as food & beverage sector leads turnover
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) started the week on a positive note, sustaining the upward momentum that had paused in Friday’s session. The ASPI advanced 77.31 points (+0.36%) to 21,676.30, while the S&P SL20 gained 7.64 points (+0.13%) to 6,119.21.

title: Two women deceive priest, wed in Church in Sri Lanka; Cardinal Ranjith raises alarm
byline: Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith, shocked the Catholic community in Sri Lanka over the weekend with the revelation of an unusual and controversial incident involving a same-sex wedding conducted in a church.

title: New rest center project launched on Southern Expressway in Matara
byline: The construction of a new rest center along the Southern Expressway was inaugurated today (29) in Udukawa, Matara, under the patronage of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Ministry Secretary Prof. Kapila C. K. Perera.
